tourBios.curYrHigh: Bounced back from a disappointing missed cut at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season opening Avianca Colombia Open with a solid T4 finish at the Lexus Panama Classic. Playing on a sponsor exemption he posted four rounds of par or better in windy conditions, including a final round of 4-under 68.
tourBios.carHigh:
2011: Defeated José Manuel Garrido in a playoff for the title of the 53rd Abierto de Bucaramanga. That victory in his home country secured him a PGA TOUR Latinoamérica spot after propelling him to 19th on the 2011 Tour de las Americas' Order of Merit... His 2011 season also included a victory at the 64th Colombia Open.

2010: Began his professional career in June of 2010 with consecutive runner-up finishes on Tour de las Américas' events in Colombia.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: A two-time winner of both the South American Amateur Championship and the Colombia Amateur Championship... Played college golf for one and a half years at South Eastern Louisiana University, where he was named Southland Conference USA Player of the Year.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Bounced back from a disappointing missed cut at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season opening Avianca Colombia Open with a solid T4 finish at the Lexus Panama Classic. Playing on a sponsor exemption he posted four rounds of par or better in windy conditions, including a final round of 4-under 68.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri in 2016 is T4th at the Lexus Panama Classic.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T32nd in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Latinoamérica.
